inclusion.criterion: Willing to submit tissue samples for mandatory central pathology review submission
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Tissue must have been determined to have local 1p/9q co-deletion and IDH mutation prior to submission for central path review
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Tumor tissue must show co-deletion of chromosomes 1p and 19q
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Tumor must also show evidence of IDH mutation by immunohistochemistry or genomic analyses
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Newly diagnosed and =< 3 months from surgical diagnosis
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Histological evidence of World Health Organization (WHO) grade III anaplastic glioma or WHO grade II low grade glioma with locally diagnosed combined 1p/19q loss and the presence of an either IDH1 or IDH2
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients with codeleted low grade gliomas must also be considered 'high risk' by exhibiting one or more of the following characteristics: Age >= 40 and any surgical therapy
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Age < 40 with prior and subtotal resection or biopsy (i.e., anything less than gross total resection)
inclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Men or women of childbearing potential who are unwilling to employ adequate contraception or contraceptive method during this study and 6 months following the completion of chemotherapy treatments
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient is a 45-year-old man with a history of anaplastic astrocytoma of the spine complicated by severe lower extremity weakness and urinary retention s/p Foley catheter, high-dose steroids, hypertension, and chronic pain.
